DOC.brief_summary: This RCT will have two arms: A control group that receives the standard of care from audiologists and an experimental group that receives both the standard of care and the at-home use of the TELLYHealth intervention. Subjects in each group will complete questionnaires at enrollment, mid-study and at the end of the study.
DOC.brief_title: Hearing Aid Education and Adaptation System
DOC.detailed_description: HTM will develop the "TELLYHealth (tm) system" that will provide education on hearing aid use and maintenance, a troubleshotting guide, and a patient diary. The content will include interactive lessons on real-world communications strategies to help all patients derive maximum value from their hearing aids. HTM will conduct a randomized controlled trial (RCT) to quantify the benefits of TELLYHealth to patients and audiologists including: reductions in hearing handicap, improved knowledge of hearing aid handling, use and communications strategies; and improved audiologist aftercare. The investigators will recruit 80 subjects (half in each group) and each subject will participate in the study for 12 weeks.
DOC.criteria: Speaks and reads English fluently Has mild (2640 dB) to moderate (4155 dB) binaural sensorineural hearing loss Will be fitted with 1 or 2 hearing aids for the first time at the time of enrollment Owns a standard TV, and either a tablet computer with Internet access or a smartphone Has sufficient corrected vision to watch videos and read text on the TV No signs of dementia Prior use of hearing amplification
